result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Keith Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with current sentence

miscConds.notes: Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to current sentence

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Keith Scott
